a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Income inequality vs. GDP per capita, 1985 to 2022
The Gini coefficient measures inequality on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality. GDP
is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
Average annual change in GDP per capita
Average annual change in gini coefficient
Data source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024); World Bank (2023)
Note: GDP data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, inequality data relates to income
measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita.
